JGnuplot.header: ~ set macros # Enable the use of macros set terminal $terminal$ set output $output$ set xlabel $xlabel$ set ylabel $ylabel$ set zlabel $zlabel$ set xrange $xrange$ set yrange $yrange$ set zrange $zrange$ info1(i)=value(sprintf("info%i",i)) info2(i,j)=value(sprintf("info%i_%i",i,j)) $infos()$ $extra$
JGnuplot.style2d: ~ # define axis # remove border on top and right and set color to gray set style line 11 lc rgb '#808080' lt 1 set border 3 back ls 11 set tics nomirror # define grid set style line 12 lc rgb '#808080' lt 0 lw 1 set grid back ls 12 set termoption dashed # Line styles: set style line 1 lc rgb "#A00000" lt 1 lw 2 pt 1 set style line 2 lc rgb "#00A000" lt 2 lw 2 pt 6 set style line 3 lc rgb "#5060D0" lt 3 lw 2 pt 2 set style line 4 lc rgb "#F25900" lt 4 lw 2 pt 9
JGnuplot.style3d: ~ set format cb "%4.1f" set colorbox user size .03, .6 noborder set cbtics scale 0
JGnuplot.plot2d: ~ $header$ $style2d$ set title "$info(1)$" plot for [i=1:$size(1)$] '-' title info2(1,i) w lp ls i $data2d(1)$
JGnuplot.plot3d: ~ $header$ $style3d$ set pm3d set title info1(1) splot for [i=1:$size(1)$] "-" using 1:2:3 title info2(1,i) $data3d(1)$
JGnuplot.multiplot: ~ $header$ $style2d$ set multiplot layout $size()$,1 set title "$info(1)$" plot for [i=1:$size(1)$] '-' title info2(1,i) w lp ls i $data2d(1)$ set title "$info(2)$" plot for [i=1:$size(2)$] '-' title info2(2,i) w lp ls i $data2d(2)$ set title "$info(3)$" plot for [i=1:$size(3)$] '-' title info2(3,i) w lp ls i $data2d(3)$ set title "$info(4)$" plot for [i=1:$size(4)$] '-' title info2(4,i) w lp ls i $data2d(4)$ set title "$info(5)$" plot for [i=1:$size(5)$] '-' title info2(5,i) w lp ls i $data2d(5)$ unset multiplot
